alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 09 at 2:57AM AKST until November 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 14 inches. * WHERE...Anchorage. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be hazardous. Heavy snow on trees and power lines could result in power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest totals for the hillside. Several inches of snow accumulation are expected through late this evening before a possible transition to rain during overnight hours. The likelihood of rain continues to decrease. Should any rain occur overnight, this would result in very slick roads with rain on ice as well as ponding of water.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
